variable description: The AOD is the effective depth of the aerosol column from the viewpoint of radiation propagation: Vertical column integral of spectral aerosol extinction coefficient AOD = exp(-K. Δz) where K is the extinction coefficient [km-1 ] and Δz the vertical path [km]
2D field of total amount of O3 (ozone) molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from tropopause to stratopause

Effective depth of a cloud from the viewpoint of radiation extinction. OD = exp(-K.Δz) where K is the extinction coefficient [km-1 ], Δz the vertical path [km] between the base and the top of the cloud and the reference wavelength to be specified in the metadata.

3D field of amount of HDO (Water vapour (with one hydrogen nucleus replaced by its deuterium isotope) , expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)
2D field of total amount of O3 (ozone) molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from tropopause to stratopause
Thickness of the ice sheet. It is related to sea-ice elevation and ice density
Fraction of an ocean area where ice is present
Elevation of the surface of the sea-ice sheet above sea level
Snow status (wet/dry)
Sea-ice surface characteristics (albedo, meltpond, dust, snow properties, temperature)
Flux of carbon dioxide from the surface to the atmosphere

Processed from land surface imagery by assigning identified cluster(s) within a given area to specific classes of objects - Accuracy expressed as number of classes. Actually [ classes-1 ] is used, so that smaller figure corresponds to better performance, as usual.
Aera extent of the surface of a lake
Total amount of vegetation in a reference area - Physical unit: [ t/ha (tons/hectare) ] - Accuracy unit: [ t/ha ]
Volume of water flowing through a river per unit of time
Fractional content of water in a volume of wet soil. Surface layer (upper few centimetres)
Deviation of sea level from the geoid caused by ocean currents (after corrections for tides and atmospheric pressure effects) - Physical unit: [ cm ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm ].
Salinity of sea water in the surface layer (upper ~ 1 m if observed in MW).  In the open ocean the correct term should be  “halinity” with reference of the diversity of salts involved.
Optically measurable component of the dissolved organic matter in water.
Partial pressure of carbon dioxide at the surface of the sea
The cumulated concentration of inorganic carbon species (dissolved carbon dioxide, carbonic acid, bicarbonate and carbonate) in solution.
Total number of ionized particles in a volume unit of ionospheric plasma
Velocity of bulk plasma or electrons (depending on measurement technique) as a function of altitude in the ionosphere.
Magnitude and direction of the 3D magnetic field on the surface of Earth and within the magnetosphere (i.e., in low-Earth orbit and in geosynchronous orbit).
Radiative flux integrated over the gamma-ray domain.
Energy spectrum of the radiative flux measured in the gamma-ray domain.
Indicative of the statics and dynamics of the lithosphere and the mantle - Physical unit: [ mGal ] where : 1 Gal = 0.01 m.s-2
Geothermal energy is heat derived from Earth's interior. Resources include hot springs and wells, hot dry rock, and even molten rock. These may be converted into heat and electricity.
Magnitude and direction of the 3D magnetic field on the surface of Earth and within the magnetosphere (i.e., in low-Earth orbit and in geosynchronous orbit).
Gradient of the Earth’s gravity field measured at the satellite orbital height - Physical unit: [ E ] , Eötvös (1 E = 1 mGal / 10 km) - Accuracy unit: [ E ].
